【考法 1】 vt. 嘲笑： to speak of or treat with contemptuous mirth
【例】 my brothers derided our efforts, but were forced to eat their words when we won first place
【近】 gibe, jeer, mock, scout, shoot down, laugh at
【反】 praise 赞美
【派】 derision n. 嘲弄：contemptuous or jeering laughter; ridicule
【反】 veneration 尊敬
【记】 源自ridicule 嘲笑；de 反 + ride 骑，反过来骑，张果老倒骑驴受嘲笑
【另】 ridiculous 荒谬可笑的
